Legal_Issue: Reasonableness and fairness of immigration officer's decision on H&C and PRRA applications
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, subsection 25(1)
Evidence_Assessment: New evidence did not show substantial risk of persecution for PRRA; hardship factors in H&C
Decision_Outcome: H&C decision set aside; PRRA application dismissed
Burden_of_Proof: On applicant to demonstrate humanitarian and compassionate grounds or risk of persecution
Legal_Rule: Subsection 25(1) IRPA; 'unusual, undeserved or disproportionate hardship' per IP5 Manual
Procedural_Issue: Conflation of 'unusual and undeserved' with 'disproportionate hardship' in H&C assessment
Grounds_for_Claim: Unreasonable H&C refusal; lack of substantial risk in PRRA
Outcome_on_Merits: H&C claim succeeded on procedural unreasonableness; PRRA claim failed on merits
Judicial_Review_Outcome: H&C remitted to new officer; PRRA dismissal upheld
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Procedural fairness upheld in PRRA; issue in H&C due to misapplication of criteria
Key_Evidence_Considered: Hardship factors in H&C; new evidence of risk in PRRA
Applicant_Challenge: Challenged reasonableness and fairness of negative H&C and PRRA decisions
Court_Result: Partial success: H&C remitted, PRRA dismissed
Legal_Rule_Source: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act; IP5 Manual
Defendant_Response: Immigration officer defended decisions as compliant with law and policy
Evidence_Type: Documentary evidence, personal circumstances, country condition reports
Outcome: H&C decision set aside and remitted; PRRA dismissed
Remedy_Sought: Judicial review, re-assessment by different officer
Resolution_Mechanism: Judicial review under Federal Courts Act
Applicable_Process: Humanitarian and Compassionate (H&C) application; Pre-Removal Risk Assessment (PRRA)
Outcome_of_Review: H&C allowed in part (remitted); PRRA dismissed
Governing_Rule: IP5 Manual guidance on 'unusual, undeserved or disproportionate hardship'
